event.name: FINISH_BEACON_HACKER

beaconType.visitedTooltip: This is the real exit beacon.

event.text: You've arrived at the exit...
It seems you've found the exit, but your Atlas won't connect. Something appears to be blocking the signal...
Suddenly, you receive a hail from a broadcast station hidden behind a small moon. "What'ssss thisss? The ssssilly little Renegade ssship isss trying to LEAVE? I'm afraid I can't allow that!"
The hacker station has been defeated, but the Rebel fleet has taken control of the beacon! You'll have to fight your way out!

choice.text: (Adv. Engines) Try to escape the Elite.

event.name: HACKER_EXIT_DEFEAT
event.text: The Hacker station has been defeated. Fortunately, your Atlas connects to the exit beacon as soon as the hacker threat is removed.

event.name: HACKED_CIVILIANS_FREECREW
event.text: A Union ship hiding from the hackers hails you. "Please, I can't keep hiding forever. Will you let me work on board your ship, so that I can escape from this bloody sector?"

choice.text: We don't need any more crew, sorry.

event.text: You apologize to them and carry on your mission.

event.name: HACKER_CIVILIAN_STATION
event.text: "A ship! I didn't think anyone would ever find us. A battalion of hackers moved through here and ransacked our station. We're out of supplies and we can't do business without them. Would you be willing to sell us some? We don't have scrap, but we can offer payment in other ways."
You transfer some fuel over to the civilians.
You transfer some ammunition over to the civilians.
You transfer some droneparts over to the civilians.
You apologize to the civilians and cut comms.

event.name: HACKER_CIVILIAN_STATION_THANK
event.text: "Thank you, we'll make sure to hide these better in case we're raided again. Now, how can we help you?"
"Yes, we can help with that. I will send out a repair team immediately!"

choice.text: We need to delay the fleet.

event.text: "I'm not sure how much we could do... but if the fleet comes by, we will lie about your location. Hopefully, they'll believe us."

choice.text: We could use a reactor upgrade.

event.text: "Yes, I think we can manage this. I'll send out a team to make some upgrades immediately."

event.name: HACKED_MILITIA
event.text: A Militia ship is passing through this system, likely trying to avoid the hackers who murdered the rest of their colleagues.
The Militia ship has received some damage from what likely was a recent battle. The crew is alive, but they're afraid and trying to flee the sector.
The militiamen thank you for your offer. You spend some time fixing their damaged systems, and are paid for your efforts.
Morals are obviously not of importance to you, as you have decided to attack the militia ship.
You don't disturb the ship and instead do something on board.
The militiamen are wary of your offer, but eventually give in. One even offers to join your crew, hoping it will provide a different way for them to protect civilians.
The militiamen are wary of your offer. They decline, not wanting to be tricked once again.

event.name: HACKER_OFFER
event.text: "Well if it issssn't the very ship I've been looking for. I'm ssssorry if my friendsss haven't given you a warm welcome, but I am here to extend an offer of kindnesss. I'm ssssure we could reach a mutually benificial trade..."

choice.text: Express interest in what they may offer.

event.text: "Ahh, I ssssee you have an eye for opportunity. Ressspectable." The hacker shows you some possible trades or services they could offer.

choice.text: Pay for detailed data on the sector.

event.text: The hackers transfer the data to your computer. Luckily, it doesn't appear to conceal any viruses.

choice.text: Pay for them to distract the fleet.

event.text: "I wassss hoping you would choossse thisssss. I will enjoy thissss job greatly..." You can imagine whatever they plan to do will be of great annoyance to the fleet.

"Sssso you wisssh to follow in our footsssteps? Cute. Really, quite cute. Don't let it go to your head, we will rule thissss sssector!" The Slug sends out a team to install the Hacking system on your ship. You make sure to keep a careful eye on them.
"Ssssshame. Try not to get killed..."
These Slug bastards are holding the civilians of this sector hostage. There's no way you're going to let them go so easily.

choice.text: We have no need for your services.

event.text: "Ssssshame. Try not to get killed..."

event.name: HACKED_PDS
event.text: A Hacker is currently interfacing with a planetary defense grid - they look distracted, and do not notice you yet. The station next to the grid hails you, but their message is garbled. "They're trying to hack our defense grid... but we're not making it easy for them! If you can help, then help. Otherwise, get out of here before it's too late!"

choice.text: (Signal Diluter) Prevent them from interfering with the defense grid.

event.text: You're able to jam the hacking signal to the station's anti-ship batteries, which allows the defense grid to only target the enemy hacker. The Union station commander seems ecstatic. "Haha! Get 'em!"

The Hacker tries to taunt you. "Haha, you fool! We have already gained accessss to the defensssse grid!" The Slugs activate the grid... although it doesn't seem to be able to distinguish friend from foe. The captain then yells at his crew: "...What do you mean we weren't done yet?"

choice.text: Offer the hacker some scrap to scram.

event.text: "Hmmm... On the one hand, if we finissssh hacking the defensssse grid you might pay more... but we are outnumbered... Fine, we will accept your offer. Goodbye!"

choice.text: Get out of there before it's too late.

event.text: You elect to get out of the region as soon as possible. Unfortunately, this leaves you with no time to spend on on-ship activities.

event.name: HACKED_PDS_RESCUE
event.text: "Thanks for intervening - they almost had us. We'll make sure any other hacker that gets close will be sorry they messed with us. Take this and keep up the good work." The station gives you some resources and a weapon for your time.

event.name: HACKED_HOSTAGES
event.text: A small civilian colony nearby appears to be under control by a group of Hackers. The civilians are helpless against their captors.
You aren't going to let some corrupt filthy Slugs hold innocent civilians hostage when you can help it. You engage the hackers.

choice.text: Pay the hackers to release the civilians.

event.text: "What issss thiss? A generoussss donation from a mysssterioussss Federation benefactor? How kind. We weren't milking much cassssh from these civiliansss anywaysss..." The hackers release control over the civilians and jump away.
Either the hackers don't notice you, or they simply don't care to deal with your ship. You ignore the colony and carry on your way.

event.name: HACKED_HOSTAGES_WIN
event.text: You've defeated the hacker ship. The rest of the hackers, afraid of you now that you've defeated their colleague, flee from the system.

The colony is grateful for your assistance. Their leader explains they specialized in the extraction of fuel from asteroids, but the hackers came looking for money. They were held hostage until they could scrounge up more scrap. Now that they're free, they give you a generous donation of fuel.

The colony is grateful for your assistance. They explain that the hackers were holding their weapon production facilities under their control to create weapons for their ships. Now that they are free, they give you one of their weapons.

event.name: HACKED_CIVILIAN_WRECK_TRAP
event.text: The wreckage of a civilian ship drifts nearby. It's unfortunate that the civilians had to die in such a way, but there's likely some supplies on board that you can salvage.

choice.text: You have no crew to perform any form of salvage.
(Slug Crew) Have your Slug check the wreckage first.
(Telepathic Shell) Have your Shell check the wreckage first.

event.text: You aren't a gang of pirates or filthy hackers. Professionals have standards.

You begin to ransack the internals of the ship when you notice a bomb planted inside the wreckage! It explodes, killing one of your crew. You retreat back to the ship when a hacker, undoubtedly the one who planted the trap, attacks.

removeCrew.text: Luckily your Clone Bay is always ready for whenever the crew may be blown up.

event.text: Nothing disturbs your salvage mission. You bring back some supplies from the ship.

To your surprise, one of the civilians appears to have survived the battle. Unfortunately, it also seems their attacker never left. With your latest recruit following behind, you prepare to fight off the hackers.
Your Slug detects a trap onboard the wreckage. A hacker ship hiding nearby, disappointed that you didn't fall for their tricks, moves in to attack!
The Slug senses nothing wrong. Your salvage mission is undisturbed. You bring back some supplies from the ship.
The Slug senses that one of the civilians survived the fight! You move in to rescue them.
Your Shell detects a trap onboard the wreckage. A hacker ship hiding nearby, disappointed that you didn't fall for their tricks, moves in to attack!
The Shell senses nothing wrong. Your salvage mission is undisturbed. You bring back some supplies from the ship.
The Shell senses that one of the civilians survived the fight! You move in to rescue them.

event.name: HACKED_FLEET_SPY
event.text: A hacker ship hails you. "Hello friendssss, it isss unfortunate that we mussst meet under thessse circumssstancessss. Assss you know, the Rebel fleet will pay a high price to know your location. That issss of courssse, unlesss you're willing to pay to keep your location a... ssssecret."

choice.text: Pay them not to alert the fleet.

event.text: "Thissss will do fine. Enjoy the ressst of your travelssss."

choice.text: We can't let this information get out! We have to kill the hackers.

event.text: You can't risk having the hackers leak your location to the fleet. You have to destroy them.
"Oh well. Hope you have ssssome fun with the Rebelssss then!" The hackers jump away.

event.name: HACKED_FANCY_CLASS
event.text: It appears a Slug and Hacker vessel are squaring off at this beacon. Judging from the dialogue you've intercepted between the ships, it seems they're arguing something about... ship classes?

The hackers won't respond to your hails, but the Slugs will. "The hackerssss have been leeching ssssshipssss from the Sssslug ssshipyardsssss for yearsss! They ressshape the interiorsss ssslightly and give them ssssome fancy namesss! Imagine the nerve of that."
You've decided to defend the Slugs and fight the Hacker vessel. Prepare for combat!
You've decided to defend the Hackers and fight the Slug vessel. Prepare for combat!
You'll stay out of a duel between two Slug ships. Mutual destruction would be a fitting end for them both.
You'll stay out of a duel between two Slug ships. Mutual destruction would be a fitting end for them both.

event.name: FANCY_CLASS_HACKER
event.text: You've defeated the Hacker vessel. You salvage the remains.
"An interesssting turn of eventsss... but not one that I'm going to complain about. Ssssome ssscrap is in order for you."

event.name: FANCY_CLASS_SLUG
event.text: You've defeated the Slug vessel. You salvage the remains.
"That wasss... unexpected. Moralssss my assss, I know you're looking for a reward. I don't ssssuppose you'd find usssse in a little delay in the Rebel fleet..."

event.name: NEBULA_LOST_SHIP_HACKER
event.text: A heavily damaged Federation ship is hiding in the nebula at this beacon. Before you have time to make contact with them, they fade into the nebula.

choice.text: Attempt to follow and help them.
Keep your position, they can handle themselves.

event.text: You decide not to chase after the Feds.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Lock onto their life-signs with your teleporter.

event.text: You beam the Federation crew aboard. One gladly joins your crew, the rest wait to be dropped off at the next station.

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Pump extra power into your sensors and try to track them.

event.text: Your search is hopeless. Your sensors can't pick up anything in the nebula.
While searching fruitlessly through the nebula, you stumble upon the Hacker ship which the Federation loyalists were likely hiding from. You prepare for a fight.
You get lucky and find them floating not too deep into the nebula. Thrilled to be found by friendlies, they come on board and abandon their wrecked ship.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_HACKER_DISTRESS
textList.text: Despite the distress beacon being encoded as a Civilian signal, the source of the signal was a Hacker ship, lying in wait for someone to fall into their trap!
The original source of this distress beacon is gone, now replaced by a hostile Hacker vessel!
"Ahhh, you would not believe how eassssy it isss to trick people like you. We didn't even have to hack anything, we jusssst turned on our dissstresssss beacon and waited!"
The hacker ship at this beacon makes it clear that the distress beacon was merely a trap!

event.name: DISTRESS_HACKER_MILITIA
event.text: The distress beacon here appears to originate from a Militia ship, currently fleeing from a Hacker vessel.
This sector needs all of the Militiamen that it can, and you aren't going to let the Hackers kill any more of them.
You can't risk your mission by rescuing the Militia ship. You carry on.

event.name: DISTRESS_HACKER_MILITIA_WIN
event.text: The hacker ship has been defeated. You scrap the ship.
It appears most of the Militiamen did not survive the attack. The lone survivor, their captain, offers to join your crew.

event.name: QUEST_HACKER_HOSPITAL
event.text: "Incoming ship, I don't know who you are or why you've come here, but please, hear me out. The hackers... they've captured a hospital in a nearby system. Many of us have family there, and we can't afford to pay their ransom. Please, you're their only hope."
The civilians forward the location of the occupied hospital. "Do everything you can, please."
The voice on the other side sobs, and shortly disconnects.

event.name: QUEST_HACKER_HOSPITAL_DESTINATION
event.text: The hospital at this beacon is indeed guarded by a hacker vessel as you were told. They swiftly hail: "If you don't have our ranssssom, then you'd besssst leave immediately."

choice.text: Attack the hackers holding the hospital hostage.

event.text: You have no intention of letting the hackers get away with their misdeeds.

choice.text: Pay the ransom to make them leave the hospital alone.

event.text: "Pleassssure doing bussssinessss with you." The Hacker vessel departs from this beacon.

choice.text: Apologize and leave as soon as you can.

event.text: "Tell thosssse humanssss they had better hurry up and pony up the dough."

event.name: HOSPITAL_SAVED
event.text: "This is the acting chief of staff of this hospital. We can't offer much, but we're in your debt. How can we help?"

choice.text: Have them upgrade your Clone Bay.

event.text: "Our lab technicians could do this in their sleep. I hope this helps you on your mission."
"Our lab technicians could do this in their sleep. I hope this helps you on your mission."

choice.text: Have them install an onboard lab for crew upgrades.

event.text: "Our researchers have state of the art lab equipment. We can spare some on your behalf."

choice.text: Have them upgrade your onboard lab.

event.text: "Our researchers have state of the art lab equipment. We can spare some on your behalf."

choice.text: Ask for a member of their medical staff to join you.

event.text: "That won't be a problem. We've got an aide who would rather be anywhere else than this sector right now."

choice.text: Ask if they can delay the fleet.

event.text: "We'll do what we can, but don't expect a miracle here, Renegade."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_HACKER
textList.text: "You made your lassst missstake coming here, Federation sssship. Thisss isss our sssssector now!"
A hacker ship tails you far from behind as you explore this beacon. As they slowly inch closer, it's apparent that they're looking for a fight.
"Oh goodnesssss, we are blesssed to be in the pressence of a Federation vesssel!" Before you can respond back, the hackers interject, "Jussssst kidding! Prepare to die."
You detect a foreign signal on your computer. While in the process of discerning its origin, a hacker ship jumps out and attacks!
The Hackers have taken control of this sector, and they aren't keen on letting others in. The ship here prepares to defend its claim over this territory.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_HACKER_PIRATE
textList.text: This sector may be under the control of the Hacker clan, but that doesn't mean it doesn't have pirates swarming around as well. A pirate ship at this beacon spots you and attacks.
A pirate ship, idly exploring this sector, spots you and wastes no time in attacking.
Hackers aren't the only pirates who can be found in this sector. The hostile ship at this beacon is evidence of this.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_HACKER_REBEL
event.text: A Rebel ship comes speeding towards you. "Damn it! The hackers took control of this sector while we were stationed here, and we have to find our way out! Now a Federation ship is here too? Hell, we gotta get to the fleet..."

event.name: ENCOUNTER_HACKER_AUTO
event.text: A Rebel Auto-ship, painted in hacker blue, sends you a message. "This is U-578-694. I have been repurposed to serve my new masters and destroy all intruders. Enjoy the rest of your miserable existence."

event.name: DESTROYED_HACKER_AUTO
event.text: You've defeated the hacked Auto-ship. You salvage what remains.

event.name: HACKED_DISABLED
event.text: You notice a change in the air, almost as if it's getting thinner. You check the computer to see your Life Support has been disabled! A Hacker ship hails you. "What an unfortunate thing to happen to a sssship like yoursss. If you have ssssome ssscrap, perhapsss we could sssolve thisss little... breathing problem of yoursss?"
"Good choice! We'll have that little problem taken care of rather quickly."

choice.text: You bastards, we aren't giving you anything!

event.text: "Poor decissssion... hope you won't be needing it any time sssoon!"
The hackers are dumbfounded by your apparent recovery from their cyber attack. Enraged, they raise their weapons and attack!

event.name: HACKER_CACHE

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. A hacker cache was located here.

event.text: The source of the strange garbled beacon here appears to be a Hacker Broadcasting Station. This must be one of the stations jamming the radio.
You raise your weapons and engage the broadcast station. You notice your systems fluctuating, they must have multiple combat augments onboard jamming you!
The Anti-Virus works its magic and counters the digital assault without any problems.
The Hacker ship's virus is much harder to purge than you expected, and you have to overclock the hacking system. Your systems return to normal, but your hacking has taken a huge loss.
You aren't willing to endanger yourself attacking a hacker station.

event.name: HACKER_CACHE_DEFEAT
event.text: The Hackers have been defeated. Your systems return to normal, and you move in to scrap the station.
You're about to leave when you notice a small platform and a cache nearby the wreck of the broadcast station.
The cache is rather underwhelming. You find a small amount of droneparts and nothing else.
Inside the cache is a brand new Ion weapon! You take it on board.
The cache appears to be storage for various supplies, which you help yourself to.
Inside the cache is a de-activated Engi, likely kept as a slave. You provide it with power back on your ship, and it re-activates, ready to serve on your crew.

The cache was trapped! Explosions rock the walls and you jump for cover. However, as you get back to your feet, nothing appears to have been damaged. The trap wasn't a trap after all, instead several Repair Bursts had been set off by accident!

You open the cache, and a screeching noise pierces the air. You run back to the ship and find a stream of garbled data streaming down your computer. Luckily you're able to shut it off in time, but you suspect it may confuse the Rebels for a while.

event.name: HACKER_CACHE_QUEST
event.text: It appears you've taken out all of the Hacker broadcast stations in the sector! No longer restricted, your radio suddenly gets a flood of alerts, including a high priority Federation distress signal!

event.name: HACKER_FED_DISTRESS
event.text: You've arrived at the location of the Federation distress call... except there's no Federation ship here. Instead, there's a massive Hacker cruiser waiting for you! "You think you're clever? Do you even know how long it took to sssset up all thossse ssstationss? Well, it doesssn't matter now. Thisss isss what you get for crossssing the Hacker clan'ssss path!"

event.name: HACKER_FED_WIN
event.text: Right as you finish off the hackers, a life pod detaches from the ship and spirals out into space... only for you to scoop it up and bring it aboard. Inside, you can see the surviving Slug quivering in fear.

You pry open the lifepod, and the Slug slides out slowly, hands in the air. "Ok, I sssurrender! You fight well. Too well... I'll give you anything and everything you want! Data, labor, ssscrap, all I assssk isss you don't kill me!"
